result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyler J. Kowalski in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  15CF114 and 15CF88 on the calendar for "arraignment" though counsel advise the Court that the parties are ready to proceed to disposition of these matters with agreement that calls for probation disposition on misdemeanor count 2 of 15CF88/knowingly violate child abuse restraining order.  Def pleads guilty to count 2 of 15CF88.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence: withheld for 1 year probation with conditions that def pay costs; no contact with victim alleged in the complaint (PDL).  Court makes finding for first offender's treatment/expungement per 973.015 upon def's succ. completion of probation.  As condition of probation, Def must also remain enrolled in school and attend school, working towards graduation.  15CF114 and count 1 of 15CF88 dismissed/read in, along with JO's.  Credit in the event of revocation: 4 days.

15CF88/arraignment and 15CF114 /adjourned initial called together.  Defendant Tyler J. Kowalski in court with attorney Jameson R. Whitney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Time limits previously waived, today, defense waives the prelim in 15CF114.  Prelim was already waived in 15CF88.  Atty. W states that the parties wish to move towards resolution.  DA asks for continued leave to file informations.  No objection from the Defense.  Court makes note.  3/2 at 9 for arraignments in the CF cases.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
AMENDED - Cash bond amended to signature bond.  Same conditions.
AMENDED - Cash bond amended to signature bond.  Same conditions.

Defendant Tyler J. Kowalski in court, with Atty Jameson Whitney.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Def waives reading of complaint.  Def atty will possibly waive prelim. hrg.  Def waives time period for prelim. hrg.  Atty JH asks to amend bond to signature bond, same conditions as cash bond.  Court orders the amendment.  AIA set for 1-13-16 at 9:00am.
